question: How were you prepared to be R. to the third D.?
answer: Both arms, both breasts, both knees made bare and both heels slip shot, worshipful sir.

question: On what were you received?
answer: On both points of the compasses presented to my naked breasts, worshipful sir.

question: How was this explained to you?
answer: To teach me that the most vital parts of man are situated between the breasts, so the most essential points of masonry, which are virtue, morality, and brotherly love, are situated between the two points of the compasses, worshipful sir.

question: On your entrance to the lodge, what struck your attention?
answer: All was dark, save a glimmering light in the east, worshipful sir.

question: To what did that D. allude?
answer: Even to the darkness of death, worshipful sir.

question: Am i given to understand that D. is the particular subject of this D.?
From what circumstance?
answer: From the untimely death of our grandmaster, Hiram Abiff, worshipful sir.

question: With what W.Ts was he smitted?
answer: The plum rule, level, and heavy setting maul, worshipful sir.

question: How come you in possession of these Ss.?
answer: From having figurativley represented him when I was raised to the sublime degree of a master mason, worshipful sir.

question: How were you R.?
answer: On the five points of fellowship, worshipful sir.

question: Name and afterwards explain them.
answer: 1st, hand to hand, 2nd, foot to foot, 3rd, knee to knee, 4th, breast to breast, and 5th, hand on back. 1st - Hand to hand: I greet you as a brother, 2nd - Foot to foot: I will support you in all your lawful undertakings, 3rd - Knee to knee: the posture of my daily supplications shall remind me of your wants and dispose my heart to soothe your afflictions and relieve your neccessities, 4th - Breast to breast:my breast shall be the safe and sacred repository for all your lawful secrets when intrsuted to my keeping, and 5th - Hand on back: I will uphold your good name in your absance as I would in your presence, worshipful sir.
